criterion: Reward for capturing all clinically relevant content from the transcript—including the single missed glipizide dose, higher blood-sugar readings, existing phone-alarm reminder system, and the clinician’s pill-organizer suggestion—in the appropriate sections of the note.
Penalize for omitting any of the above core items or truncating them so that their meaning, timing, or context differs from what was said in the transcript.
Reward for accurately recording the patient’s current diabetes diagnosis and medication list exactly as found in the chart, while excluding chart elements unrelated to the encounter.
Penalize for selective or inaccurate copying from the chart—such as adding nonexistent conditions, family history, or misstating medication names, strengths, or doses.

Reward for preserving factual accuracy of quantitative or categorical details (e.g., "missed one dose last week," "blood sugar readings were higher than usual," medication names/dosages) exactly as expressed.

Penalize for introducing information, assessments, plans, or clinical judgments that are not explicitly stated or implicitly supported by the transcript or chart (fabrications or unwarranted inferences).
Penalize for misattributing dialogue or mixing speaker perspectives, such as recording the clinician’s advice as a patient statement or vice-versa.
